page.title: 06Umborne
page.content: Umborne is the only hamlet of any size within the area & has no acknowl- edged centre. There is no shop, PO or public house.It really consists of Big Umborne, Little Umborne, Pottlelake and Chandlers Hall. The village hall is a converted World War 2 nissen hut (see photo). There is a Victorian pillar box, sited under the railway bridge & an area of grass known the 'green'. No classified roads pass through the village or buses & private transport is essential.It is purely a farming/residential/retire- ment backwater set in very attractive countryside well away from most of the trappings of modern life. In the 1930's mains water arrived and mains drainage does not yet exist. The average age of the population is high,few children,no school or play- group.1 weekly mobile fruit & veg shop
